translation:
Most Illustrious Sir Rodrigo Antônio da Silva, captain on duty.

By order that I received from Senhor Vicente Paulo de Oliveira Vilas Boas, I command Your Lordship Sir

Today the horses of Senhor Pelúcio and all those who have gathered to be able to follow the column that, for lack of horses, has not proceeded to this point; Your Lordship

In your rear guard Your Lordship must have Ensign José Antônio the good horses that he has sent you.

I warn Your Lordship Your Lordship

The delay of the column is because these horses that leave today, and as soon as they arrive, will set out for this point; this same thing Your Lordship will make Senhor Your Lordship Your Lordship see

Nota Bene Your Lordship His Excellency

God keep Your Lordship Mampituba Pass, February 7, 1839. Paulo Pereira da Silva Alano, Sergeant-major in charge.
